New Records: Mark Vientos hit a tiebreaking, two-run single in the fifth inning.
Jesse Winker drew a chorus of boos and appeared to exchange words with Willy Adames after hitting a two-run triple.
Jackson Chourio became the youngest player to get two hits in his playoff debut at 20 years old.
Key Match Events: The Mets scored three runs in the second inning after the Brewers took an early lead.
The Brewers pulled back ahead 4-3 in the fourth inning, but the Mets responded with five runs in the fifth inning.
Jose Iglesias dove headfirst and beat Payamps to the bag for an infield single, with Taylor racing all the way home from second to tie the game.
Brandon Nimmo reached on an infield single, and Mark Vientos hit a two-run single to right, extending the Mets' lead.
The Brewers went down quietly after that with Chourio hitting an RBI single in the fourth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Carlos Mendoza mentioned the Mets' mindset after clinching their playoff spot, stating, 'I knew we were in a good spot when we boarded the plane. We celebrated. We got out of the clubhouse in Atlanta, and you could tell right away our mentality was next day, next game.'
Post-Match Reflections: Mark Vientos expressed, 'It’s hard to be tired when you’re playing playoff baseball. I had a bunch of energy. I know all of us did. We were all excited, and we got the job done.',

Luis Severino, the Mets' starter, said, 'We’re not satisfied. We know the potential that we have in that clubhouse, and we want to go out there, and we’re going to fight. We’re going to fight until the end, and hopefully that end is going to be hopefully win the World Series.'
